title: The Multiplication Rule
text: If A and B are two events defined on a sample space, then P(A AND $$B)=P\left(B\right) P\left(A|B\right)$$. We want to find the probability that A and B both occur: this is the formula to use.

title: The Multiplication Rule Applied
text: What is P(A AND $$B)=P(B$$ AND A)?

title: The Multiplication Rule Applied
text: We know that $$P(B|A)=0.90$$. What is P(B AND $$A)=P\left(A\right) P\left(B|A\right)$$?
